intro: Potentilla lamottei, commonly known as the Lamotte cinquefoil, is a low-growing perennial shrub native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It features wiry, arching stems that bear small, yellowish-orange flowers arranged in clusters. The plant has compound leaves with five leaflets, giving it the common name "cinquefoil." It thrives in well-drained soils and is adapted to cold, alpine environments. Potentilla lamottei is often cultivated for its ornamental value and hardy nature.
